  "Allegations" : "I WAS THE BRANCH MANAGER.  THE [CUSTOMERS] CLAIMED 2 OEX OPTIONS, WHICH WERE SOLD IN ITEM ACCOUNT, WERE UNSUITABLE AND THE RISK WAS MISREPRESENTED.  THE ARBITRATION WAS BOUGHT AGAINST PRU-BACHE, THE BROKER AND ME, AN OFFICE MANAGER.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$20,000.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$10,453.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "Y",

  "Broker Comment" : "THERE WERE NO PENALTIES AND PRU-BACHE WROTE ME ON 9/7/89 THAT \"PRUDENTIAL BACHE SECURITIES, INC. WILL NOT ATTEMPT TO SEEK INDEMNIFICATION OR CON TRIBUTION.....WITH REFERENCE TO THE...ARBITRATION.\" THE MATTER WAS SETTLED 6/1/89 FOR $10,453.00 PRIOR TO ARBITRATION. THE CRUX OF THE CASE INVOLVES AN ALLEGED MISREPRESENTATION OF RISK AND A BROKER'S INDUCEMENT TO INFLATE INCOME AND NET WORTH ESTIMATES ON THE OPTION AGREEMENT.  IN FACT THE CLIENT DID SIGN THE OPTION FORM AND GIVEN THE ESTIMATE OF $65,000 INCOME AND 300000 NET WORTH, THEY WERE SUITABLE FOR THE TRANSACTION IN QUESTION."
